title.narrative: Emergency and Recovery Assistance to Cyclone Yaas Affected People in Bangladesh

description.narrative:
Cyclone Yaas made landfall on 26 May 2021 leaving hundreds of villages and acres of land flooded and thousands of households have been inundated. Peoples’ livelihoods have been severely affected which will last up to years as fishing ghers (water body of fish cultivation), agricultural lands and huge numbers of livestock and poultry have been washed away, small businesses have been destroyed and day laborers are out of work. Thousands of houses have been either completely destroyed or partially damaged, fresh water source and sanitation facilities are submerged and inaccessible and communication has been disrupted. Apart from that, local markets, health institutions and educational institutions are also severely or partially damaged. The poor and vulnerable coastal people of Bangladesh still sufferings from the devastations of cyclone Amphan and the most recent cyclone YAAS (26 May 2021) has added new losses and damages. Such recurrent disaster accumulating their impacts over the time and weakening the capacity of local communities of coastal regions.
he proposed activities will take place over 7 months, targeting 20,583 people and will address the most urgent life-saving gaps. The response is well balanced in terms of sectoral coverage, CB plan to provide cash, cash for work, shelter, hygiene kits and WASH – excavating wells and repairing/building latrines.
